quiz.text: With reference to Earth Summit, consider the following statements: 1. It is the United Nations Conference on Environment and Development that took place in 1992 in Rio de Janeiro. 2. Agenda 21, a non-binding action plan, was an outcome of this summit.  3. An important achievement of the summit was an agreement on the Climate Change Convention which in turn led to the Kyoto Protocol and the Paris Agreement. Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
options: 1 only
2 only
1 and 3 only
2 and 3 only
1,2 and 3

quiz.text: TRAFFIC, an non-governmental organization was established by 1. World Wide Fund for Nature 2. United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) 3. International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) Select the correct answer using the code given below:
options: 1 only
2 only
1 and 3 only
2 and 3 only
1, 2 and 3

quiz.text: Consider the following statements with reference to the 'Wildlife Protection Act': 1. It provides for the protection of both animals and plant species. 2. It has six schedules which provide for varying degrees of protection. 3. Schedule V includes the animals which may be hunted. Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
options: 1 and 2 only
1 and 3 only
2 and 3 only
1, 2 and 3
1 only

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements with respect to Compressed Bio-Gas (CBG):
  1. Biogas is purified to remove carbon dioxide and hydrogen sulfide gases to prepare CBG.
  2. CBG has a calorific value similar to CNG and hence can be utilized as green renewable automotive fuel.
  3. The CBG can be transported through cylinder cascades or pipelines to retail outlets.
Which of the statements given above are correct?
options: 1  and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1, 2 and 3
1 and 3 only
3 only

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding “Climate Financing”:1. Global Environment Facility (GEF) was established under UNEP’s Rio Earth Summit, in 1992.2. World Bank serves as Green Climate Fund (GCF)‘s trustee.3. Half of the adaption resources must be invested in the most climate vulnerable countries Which of the above statement is/are correct?
options: 1 and 2 only
1 and 3 only
2 and 3 only
1, 2 and 3
2 only

quiz.text: The ''Stockholm Conference, 1972'', is related to
options: The United Nations Conference on Safety in Civil Aviation.
The United Nations Conference on Safety in Civil Aviation.
The United Nations Conference for the Protection of the Ozone Layer
The United Nations Conference on Human Environment
None of the above

quiz.text: Consider the following pairs of Conventions and the subject it deals with:Convention          : :                        Subject it deals with1. Basel Convention: :              Certain Hazardous Chemicals and Pesticides in International Trade2. Rotterdam Convention::      Transboundary Movements of Hazardous Waste and their  Disposal3. Stockholm Convention: :      Persistent Organic Pollutants (POP)Which of the above pairs are NOT correctly matched?
options: 1 and 2 only
1 and 3 only
2 and 3 only
All of the above
3 only

quiz.text: What is sustainable development?
options: The development that meets the needs of the present without compromising the ability of future generations to meet their own needs.
To conserve natural resources and to develop alternate sources of power while reducing pollution and harm to the environment.
It is the practice of developing land and construction projects in a manner that reduces their impact on the environment by allowing them to create energy-efficient models of self-sufficiency.
All of the above
None of the above

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements with respect to Loss and Damage (L&D):
  1. Under L&D, rich countries that have a historical responsibility for climate change are asked to be liable to the developing countries.
  2. Warsaw International Mechanism (WIM) acknowledges that “loss and damage” are associated with the adverse effects of climate change.
  3. Paris Agreement provides a basis for the liability of industrialized countries towards developing countries under the loss and damage framework.
options: 1 only
1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1, 2 and 3
1 and 3 only

quiz.text:
Which of the following are correct regarding Sustainable development goals? 
  1. They were accepted by the governments in COP 21 
  2. There are a total of 17 goals present under SDG. 
  3. SDG talks about inequality within the country only and nothing about between the countries. 
Codes:
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
2 only
All of the above
3 only

quiz.text: The “4 per 1000” initiative, sometimes seen in the news is related to which of the following?
options: Renewable energy
Electric vehicles

Biodiversity conservation

quiz.text: The “Race To Zero Campaign” is related to which of the following?

quiz.text: Which of the following UN commission is responsible for reviewing progress in the implementation of Agenda 21 and the Rio Declaration on Environment and Development?
options: United Nation Disarmament Commission
United Nations Statistical Commission
United Nations Commission on Sustainable Development (CSD)

quiz.text: Where was the sustainable development explained for the first time?
options: World Development Report

Human Development Report

quiz.text: Which of the following is not a sustainable development goal targeted to be achieved by 2030?
options: Gender Equality
Zero Hunger

Space Research

quiz.text: The discussion on Sustainable Development was started after submitting a report on environment to the United Nation in 1987. Which was the report?
options: First Report on Climate Change
Our Common Future
First Report on Climate Change
Fifth Assessment Report

quiz.text: At the Central Government level, which agency was assigned the role of overseeing the implementation of Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)?
options: The Energy Resource Institute (TERI)
NITI Aayog
Center for Environmental and Sustainable Development India (CESDI)
The Comptroller and Auditor General of India (CAG)

quiz.text:
Which of the following international conventions/protocols is/are related to the ozone layer depletion?
  1. Montreal Protocol 
  2. Kyoto Protocol
  3. Stockholm Convention
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
options: 1 only
1 and 3 only
2 and 3 only
1, 2 and 3
2 only

quiz.text: Consider the following statements: 1) Environment (Protection) Act was enacted in the year 1986. 2) It was passed to provide protection and improvement of the environment. 3) The Wildlife (Protection) Act, enacted in the year 1972, for the protection of animals only. Choose the correct option using the code given below:
options: 1 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
1 and 2 only
1, 2 and 3

quiz.text: Consider the following statements with respect to Kyoto Protocol: 1) It is an international treaty to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change. 2) It is an international treaty that aims to protect Ozone layer. 3) It was adopted in 1997 but came into force in 2009. 4) The first commitment period was between 2009-2013 Choose the correct option using the code given below:
options: 1 only
1 and 4 only
2, 3 and 4 only
1, 2 and 4 only
1, 2, 3 and 4

quiz.text: Consider the following statements with respect to National Action Plan on Climate Change: 1) It was formally launched in 2010. 2) There are 10 National Missions which form the core of National Action Plan.  3) They focus on promoting understanding of climate change, adaptation and mitigation, energy efficiency and natural resource conservation. Choose the correct option using the code given below:
options: 1 only
2 and 3 only
1, 2 and 3
1 and 3 only
3 only

quiz.text: Ramsar Convention" is related to which of the following?
options: Climate Change
Pesticide Pollution
Refugees Protection
Wetland Conservation

quiz.text:
The Central Government provides financial support to the States for supporting the conservation of wildlife and biodiversity.  Which of the following scheme (s) is/are supported by the central government? 
  1. Development of National Parks and Sanctuaries (DNPS).
  2. National tiger conservation authority (Project tiger).
  3. Project Elephant (PE).
Select the correct answer using the code given below
options: 1 only
1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1, 2 and 3
2 Only

quiz.text: Under which of the following Act, the Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA) has got the statutory status?
options: The Indian Wildlife (Protection) Act (1972)
The Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act (1981)
The Environment (Protection) Act (1986)
The Biological Diversity Act (2002)
None of the above

quiz.text: CITES is an international treaty on which of the following?
options: Air pollution
Water pollution
Conservation of endangered plants and animals
Climate change
None of the above

quiz.text:
It is a supplementary agreement to the UN Convention on Biological Diversity. This protocol is a legal framework for the implementation of one of the objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity, which is the fair & equitable sharing of benefits arising out of the utilization of genetic resources. The protocol was adopted in 2010. It entered into force in October 2014. The objective of the protocol is the fair and equitable sharing of benefits coming from the utilization of genetic resources and helping in the conservation & sustainable usage of biodiversity. The protocol creates obligations for members to incorporate measures in respect of access to genetic resources, sharing of benefits, and compliance. It is one of the important environmental protocols of the world.

Which of the following is discussed in the passage?
options: Cartagena Protocol
Nagoya Protocol
Kyoto Protocol
Montreal Protocol
None of the above

quiz.text:
It is the first international regulatory framework for safe transfer, handling and use of Living Modified Organisms (LMOs). It seeks to protect biological diversity from the potential risks posed by genetically modified organisms resulting from modern biotechnology. It makes clear that products from new technologies must be based on the precautionary principle and allow developing nations to balance public health against economic benefits. It has 173 parties as of June 2021.

Which of the following is discussed in the passage?
options: Nagoya Protocol
Kyoto Protocol
Cartagena Protocol
Montreal Protocol
None of the above

quiz.text: “Coastal waters are also affected by excess nutrient inputs, mostly nitrogen, from agriculture, fertilizers and sewage” – describes which of the following?
options: Eutrophication
Bio-magnification
Bio-accumulation
Ocean Acidification
Both A and B

quiz.text:
Chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) are used in which of the following?
  1. Refrigerators
  2. Foaming agents
  3. Aerosol sprays
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
options: 1 only
1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1, 2 and 3

quiz.text: Which of the following do not form part of a strategy of sustainable development?
options: Relying more on organic farming
Reducing the use of personal vehicles and promoting public transport
Safeguarding the habitats of indigenous communities, flora, and fauna
Compromising on the needs of the Future generation with respect to present generations
None of the above

options: 2025
2027

2035

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding the Climate & Clean Air Coalition(CCAC):
  1. It aims at protecting the climate through actions to reduce short-lived climate pollutants.
  2. India is a state partner of the CCAC.
  3. Climatic and Clean Air Coalition (CCAC) to Reduce Short-Lived Climate Pollutants is a unique initiative of the G20 group of countries. 
  4. The CCAC focuses on methane, black carbon, and hydrofluorocarbons. 
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1,2 and 4 only
2, 3 and 4 only
All of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are the Nationally Determined Contributions (NDC) of India under the Paris Agreement?
  1. To reduce the emissions intensity of GDP by 45 percent by 2030 below 2005 levels.
  2. To increase the share of non-fossil-based energy resources to 50 percent of installed electric power capacity by 2030.
  3. To put forward and further propagate a healthy and sustainable way of living based on traditions and values of conservation and moderation, including through a mass movement for ‘LIFE’– ‘Lifestyle for Environment’ as a key to combating climate change.
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
options: 1 only
1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
All of the above

quiz.text:

  1. Carbon Dioxide
  2. Methane
  3. Water Vapour
  4. Particulate matter

options: 1, 2, and 3 only

1, 2, 3 and 5 only

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding the Adaptation Fund (AF):
  1. It was established under the Kyoto Protocol of the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change.
  2. AF-funded projects are implemented around the world through accredited National Implementing Entities, Multilateral Implementing Entities and Regional Implementing Entities.
  3. NABARD is the National Implementing Entity of India.

options: 1 only

2 and 3 only

quiz.text:

2 and 3 only

Only 3

quiz.text:

  2. Household waste
  3. Critical care medical equipment
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
1,2 and 3

options: 50-55%

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding Climate Ambition Alliance (CAC): 1. It was led by India at the 25th Conference of the Party of UNFCCC.2. Under this CAC, targets are more ambitious than defined in Paris Agreement.3. This alliance includes regions, cities, and investment companies. Choose the correct option from below:
options: 1 and 2 only
1 and 3 only
2 and 3 only

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements about afforestation measures taken by the international organization:
  1. Deforestation and forest degradation account for carbon emissions, more than the entire global transportation sector and energy sector.
  2. UN-REDD, launched by UNFCCC, incentivize the country for sustaining forests.
  3. REDD+ focused to mitigate climate change by reducing net emissions of greenhouse gases through enhanced forest management in developing countries.
Which of the above-given statement are incorrect?
options: 1 and 2 only
1 and 3 only
2 and 3 only
All of the above

quiz.text:
Kyoto Protocol and Paris Agreement are two significant measures to contain environmental degradation. But there are differences in their approaches. Which of thefollowing are some of those differences?
  1. Kyoto Protocol had differentiated between developed and developing countries, while there were no such differences in Paris Agreement.
  2. Kyoto Protocol has set a binding target for some developing countries, while Paris Agreement has no such binding target.
  3. Kyoto Protocol’s objective is the reduction of emission of 6 major Green House Gas, while Paris Agreement targets temperature control.
Choose the correct option from below:
options: 1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
1 and 3 only
1 only
All of the above

quiz.text: Consider the following statements with regard to Coalition for Disaster Resilient Infrastructure: 1. It is a multi-stakeholder global partnership of national governments, UN agencies and programmes, multilateral development banks and financing mechanisms, the private sector, and knowledge institutions. 2. It aims to promote the resilience of new and existing infrastructure systems to climate and disaster risks in support of sustainable development 3. It was launched at the UN Climate Action Summit 2017 Choose the correct option using the code given below
options: Only 1
Only 1 and 2
Only 1 and 3
Only 2 and 3
1, 2 and 3
